Macros

#define MCSPI_NUMINSTANCES   (1U)
 maximum number fo instances supported by this driver. Default value will be 1. This will be updated depending on the CPU in xs file
 
#define MCSPI_BIOSPWRM_ENABLE   (FALSE)
 Enable/disbale the support for BIOS power management.
 
#define BUFFER_DATA_SIZE   (32U)
 Local Buffer data allocation for transcieve operation.
 
#define MCSPI_EDMAENABLE   (TRUE)
 configuration variable for enabling or disabling the edma support
 
#define MCSPI_PARAM_CHECK_ENABLE   (TRUE)
 enable to have parameter validation in the public functions
 
#define MCSPI_NUM_LOG_CHANS   (1U)
 Max SPI driver opens - which means number of s/w channels which can be opened for a single instance of SPI.
 
#define MCSPI_EDMA_BASE_ADDR   (0x40000000U)
 This is the edma base address added to the McSPI registers while configuring the EDMA src/dst address.
 
#define MCSPI_MAX_CHAN_SUPPORTED   (4U)
 Max SPI driver opens - which means number of physical channels which can be opened for a single instance of SPI. The instance 0 of Spi -> 4 channels available The instance 1 of Spi -> 2 channels available The instance 2 of Spi -> 2 channels available The instance 3 of Spi -> 1 channel available.
 
#define CLOCK_REF_FREQUENCY   (48000000)
 The reference frequency for McSPI.
 
#define MCSPI_RX_FIFO_LEN   (32U)
 Since the McSPI support only transmit-receive mode, the FIFO is shared among transmit and receive i.e each of 32 bytes. More...
 
#define MCSPI_TX_FIFO_LEN   (32U)
 Transmit FIFO lenght.
 

Enumerations

enum  Mcspi_OpMode { MCSPI_OPMODE_POLLED = 0, MCSPI_OPMODE_INTERRUPT, MCSPI_OPMODE_DMAINTERRUPT }
 Enumeration of the different modes of operation available for the Spi driver. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_CommMode { MCSPI_COMMMODE_MASTER = 0, MCSPI_COMMMODE_SLAVE }
 Enumeration of Master mode and slave mode of operation only one channel would be allowed to be opened in slave mode however more that one (till the max number of channel supported by driver(configurable) channel can be opened in master mode. In master mode four physical channels can be configured. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_PinOpMode { MCSPI_PINOPMODE_4PIN = 0x1, MCSPI_PINOPMODE_3PIN = 0x3 }
 MCSPI pin Opmode. This macro specifies the number of pins that will be be used by the McSpi device. This mode is used only in single channel master mode. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_ClkMode { MCSPI_MODE0, MCSPI_MODE1, MCSPI_MODE2, MCSPI_MODE3 }
 MCSPI serial clock mode. This macro specifies the 4 sub-modes of the SPI format transfer that depends on the polarity (POL) and the phase (PHA) of the SPI serial clock (SPICLK) by the McSpi device. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_ChipSelTimectrl { MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE0, MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE1, MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE2, MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE3 }
 This field defines the number of interface clock cycles between CS toggling and first or last edge of SPI clock. More...
 
enum  pllDomains { PLLDOMAIN_0 = 0, PLLDOMAIN_1 = 1, PLLDOMAIN_NONE = 2 }
 PLL domain to be used by the device. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_WordLen {
  MCSPI_LEN_4BIT = 0x04, MCSPI_LEN_8BIT = 0x08, MCSPI_LEN_16BIT = 0x10, MCSPI_LEN_24BIT = 0x18,
  MCSPI_LEN_32BIT = 0x20
}
 McSPI Word Length to be used by the device. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_InitDelay {
  MCSPI_NO_DELAY = 0x00, MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_4 = 0x01, MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_8 = 0x02, MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_16 = 0x03,
  MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_32 = 0x04
}
 This configuration is used to have delay for the first spi word transfer to give time for system to complete parallel processes. This option is meaningful in master mode and single channel mode. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_DataTransferMode { MCSPI_BOTH_RXTX = 0x0 }
 The McSPI transmit receive mode(TRM), this holds good for both master as well as slave mode of operation. The tx only and the rx only mode is not supported. More...

Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

#define MCSPI_RX_FIFO_LEN   (32U)

Since the McSPI support only transmit-receive mode, the FIFO is shared among transmit and receive i.e each of 32 bytes.

Receive FIFO lenght

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Mcspi_ChannelMode

This enum is used only in the master mode.

Enumerator
MCSPI_SINGLE_CHANNEL 

Use 1 channel

MCSPI_MULTI_CHANNEL 

Use multi channel

enum Mcspi_ChipSelTimectrl

This field defines the number of interface clock cycles between CS toggling and first or last edge of SPI clock.

Enumerator
MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE0 

CLK cycle 0

MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE1 

CLK cycle 1

MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE2 

CLK cycle 2

MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE3 

CLK cycle 3

enum Mcspi_ClkMode

MCSPI serial clock mode. This macro specifies the 4 sub-modes of the SPI format transfer that depends on the polarity (POL) and the phase (PHA) of the SPI serial clock (SPICLK) by the McSpi device.

Enumerator
MCSPI_MODE0 

SPICLK active high and sampling occurs on the rising edge

MCSPI_MODE1 

SPICLK active high and sampling occurs on the falling edge

MCSPI_MODE2 

SPICLK active low and sampling occurs on the falling edge

MCSPI_MODE3 

SPICLK active low and sampling occurs on the falling edge

enum Mcspi_CommMode

Enumeration of Master mode and slave mode of operation only one channel would be allowed to be opened in slave mode however more that one (till the max number of channel supported by driver(configurable) channel can be opened in master mode. In master mode four physical channels can be configured.

Enumerator
MCSPI_COMMMODE_MASTER 

Master Mode

MCSPI_COMMMODE_SLAVE 

Slave Mode

enum Mcspi_DatalineDirection

To configure the Dat0/Dat1 as the IN(Rx) or as OUT(Tx)

Enumerator
MCSPI_IN 

Data line Direction as IN

MCSPI_OUT 

Data line Direction as OUTPUT

enum Mcspi_DataTransferMode

The McSPI transmit receive mode(TRM), this holds good for both master as well as slave mode of operation. The tx only and the rx only mode is not supported.

Enumerator
MCSPI_BOTH_RXTX 

Full duplex

enum Mcspi_InitDelay

This configuration is used to have delay for the first spi word transfer to give time for system to complete parallel processes. This option is meaningful in master mode and single channel mode.

Enumerator
MCSPI_NO_DELAY 

Have No delay

MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_4 

Delay of wordlength 4

MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_8 

Delay of wordlength 8

MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_16 

Delay of wordlength 16

MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_32 

Delay of wordlength 32

enum Mcspi_ioctlCmd

Mcspi Ioctl commands.

Enumerator
IOCTL_MCSPI_CANCEL_PENDING_IO 

Ioctl to cancel the current pending IO packet

IOCTL_MCSPI_SET_SPIEN_POLARITY 

Ioctl to set the chip select polarity

IOCTL_MCSPI_SET_POLLEDMODETIMEOUT 

Ioctl to set the polled mode timeout

IOCTL_MCSPI_SET_TRIGGER_LVL 

Ioctl to set the trigger level for FIFO

enum Mcspi_OpMode

Enumeration of the different modes of operation available for the Spi driver.

Enumerator
MCSPI_OPMODE_POLLED 

Polled Mode

MCSPI_OPMODE_INTERRUPT 

Interrupt Mode

MCSPI_OPMODE_DMAINTERRUPT 

DMA Mode

enum Mcspi_PinOpMode

MCSPI pin Opmode. This macro specifies the number of pins that will be be used by the McSpi device. This mode is used only in single channel master mode.

Enumerator
MCSPI_PINOPMODE_4PIN 

SPI master 4 pin mode

MCSPI_PINOPMODE_3PIN 

SPI master 3 pin mode uses SPISCS

enum Mcspi_SpienSlv

Chip Selects to be used by the device.

Enumerator
MCSPI_SPIEN_0 

chip select 0

MCSPI_SPIEN_1 

chip select 1

MCSPI_SPIEN_2 

chip select 2

MCSPI_SPIEN_3 

chip select 3

enum Mcspi_WordLen

McSPI Word Length to be used by the device.

Enumerator
MCSPI_LEN_4BIT 

Set to Length 4

MCSPI_LEN_8BIT 

Set to Length 8

MCSPI_LEN_16BIT 

Set to Length 16

MCSPI_LEN_24BIT 

Set to Length 24

MCSPI_LEN_32BIT 

Set to Length 32

enum pllDomains

PLL domain to be used by the device.

Enumerator
PLLDOMAIN_0 

PLL domain 0

PLLDOMAIN_1 

PLL domain 1

PLLDOMAIN_NONE 

Not in any pll domain

Function Documentation

static Void Mcspi_ChanParams_init ( Mcspi_ChanParams *  chanParams)
inlinestatic

Mcspi_ChanParams structure init function.

Parameters
chanParams[IN] Pointer to Mcspi_ChanParams structure.
Void Mcspi_init ( Void  )

Initializes McSPI instances which are statically allocated.

This function needs to ve be called at part of BIOS initialization by setting initFxn for that particular UDEV instance or by calling this function as part of user specific initFxn.

Variable Documentation

const IOM_Fxns Mcspi_IOMFXNS

Mcspi IOM_Fxns table.

Driver function table to be used by applications.

const Mcspi_Params Mcspi_PARAMS

Default Mcspi_Params struct.

Following values are defaults and application can assign and change interested parameters.

const struct Mcspi_Params Mcspi_PARAMS = {

0, instNum MCSPI_OPMODE_POLLED, opMode 16, hwiNumber FALSE, enableCache 0, edma3EventQueue { CommMode_MASTER, masterOrSlave SINGLE_CHANNEL, singleOrMultiChEnable PinOpMode_4PIN, pinOpModes 1, fifoRxTrigLvl 1, fifoTxTrigLvl [ { LEN_8BIT, charLength FALSE, multiWordAccessEnable FALSE, spiChipSelectEnablePol mode0, clockMode 0, clockRatioExtension NO_DELAY, spiWordInitDelay BOTH_RXTX, trasmitReceiveMode FALSE, granularityEnable 3000000, busFreq FALSE, spienHighPolarity SPIEN_0, slaveModeChipSelect IN, spiDat0Dir OUT spiDat1Dir }, { LEN_8BIT, charLength FALSE, multiWordAccessEnable TRUE, spiChipSelectEnablePol mode0, clockMode 0, clockRatioExtension NO_DELAY, spiWordInitDelay BOTH_RXTX, trasmitReceiveMode FALSE, granularityEnable 3000000, busFreq FALSE, spienHighPolarity SPIEN_0, slaveModeChipSelect IN, spiDat0Dir OUT spiDat1Dir }, { LEN_8BIT, charLength FALSE, multiWordAccessEnable TRUE, spiChipSelectEnablePol mode0, clockMode 0, clockRatioExtension NO_DELAY, spiWordInitDelay BOTH_RXTX, trasmitReceiveMode FALSE, granularityEnable 3000000, busFreq FALSE, spienHighPolarity SPIEN_0, slaveModeChipSelect IN, spiDat0Dir OUT spiDat1Dir }, { LEN_8BIT, charLength FALSE, multiWordAccessEnable TRUE, spiChipSelectEnablePol mode0, clockMode 0, clockRatioExtension NO_DELAY, spiWordInitDelay BOTH_RXTX, trasmitReceiveMode FALSE, granularityEnable 3000000, busFreq FALSE, spienHighPolarity SPIEN_0, slaveModeChipSelect IN, spiDat0Dir OUT spiDat1Dir } ], } FALSE, prcmPwrmEnable PLLDOMAIN_0, pllDomain BIOS_WAIT_FOREVER, polledModeTimeout

};
